com.odesk.agora.mercury.consumer

Class MercuryConsumers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.odesk.agora.mercury.consumer.MercuryConsumers

  • public class MercuryConsumers
extends Object
    Created by Dmitry Solovyov on 12/25/2015.

    A registry of consumers for Mercury topics. Each topic can have only one "main consumer" and only one "DLQ consumer". The main consumer is used for normal message processing after polling from the subscription queue. The DLQ consumer processes the messages that failed to be processed by the "main" one and were moved to the dead letter queue.

    Each consumer is just an instance of Consumer. It should process the message silently or throw any RuntimeException if the processing fails.

    It is the main public API point (facade) at consumer side.

    • Method Detail

      • getConsumerForTopic

        public static Consumer<MercuryMessage> getConsumerForTopic(String topicName,
                                                           boolean dlq)
        Get a main/DLQ consumer registered for the given topic.

      • setConsumer

        public static void setConsumer(String topicName,
                               Consumer<MercuryMessage> consumer)
        Set a main consumer for the given topic. This way you could register a consumer that operates on the untyped MercuryMessage with raw MercuryMessage.serializedPayload string and performs some custom deserialization on his own.

        Note: For most cases it's more convenient to rely on the automatic deserialization provided by the MercuryDeserializers registry and use a typed consumer that operates on the TypedMessage: setTypedConsumer(String, Class, Consumer)

      • setDeserializingConsumer

        public static <T> void setDeserializingConsumer(String topicName,
                                                MercuryConsumers.DeserializerForClass<T> deserializer,
                                                Consumer<TypedMessage<T>> consumer)
        Set a deserializing main consumer for the given topic. This way you could register a typed consumer that operates on the TypedMessage, alongside with the MercuryConsumers.DeserializerForClass being used for payload deserialization. So, the raw message is first deserialized with the given deserializer, and then passed to the given consumer.

        Use this method when T class requires some tricky deserialization that is easier to be coded as MercuryConsumers.DeserializerForClass.deserialize(String, String) rather than MercuryDeserializers.DeserializerForContentType.deserialize(String, Class). For most other cases it's more convenient to rely on the automatic deserialization provided by the MercuryDeserializers registry and use setTypedConsumer(String, Class, Consumer).

        NB: if you register a consumer this way, then all messages in the given topic should contain a payload of the same (or assignable) class. Nevertheless they still could be transferred in different content-types.

      • setTypedConsumer

        public static <T> void setTypedConsumer(String topicName,
                                        Class<T> payloadClass,
                                        Consumer<TypedMessage<T>> consumer)
        Set a typed main consumer for the given topic. This way you could register a typed consumer that operates on the TypedMessage of the given payloadClass. So, the raw message is first automatically deserialized using the MercuryDeserializers registry, and then passed to the given consumer.

        This method of consumers registration match most common use-cases.

        NB: if you register a consumer this way, then all messages in the given topic should contain a payload of the same (or assignable) class. Nevertheless they still could be transferred in different content-types.
